name: enterally
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that involves putting food substances or medicine into someone's digestive system (= the organs in the body where food is digested), rather than into the veins, for example: Some drugs cannot be used enterally because their effect on the digestive tract is unclear. This drug should only be administered enterally. Related words
enteral
enteron
More examplesFewer examplesIntravenous fluids are sometimes used in a baby who cannot be fed enterally.This food is formulated to be administered enterally under medical supervision. The patients who have had complicated surgery are being fed enterally.If there is not sufficient uptake enterally, the drug may be administered intravenously.
